content.description: Some toproping routes to be had ranging from 5.6-5.10. Good enough features for kids/new climbers to play around on. Can be wet if it has rained recently.
content.protection: NO BOLTS OR CHAINS. Bring lots of long webbing/cord or another climbing rope to build an anchor off of a large tree and/or a few gear placements above the lines you want to do.

content.description: Climbs the once dirty, then cleaned, and now dirty again slab on the left end of Left Croc rock. Feel free to add bolts and an anchor.
content.protection: No top anchor. Use a tree, then walk off.
content.location: Hike underneath the Croc and around the corner from the other Left Croc routes.

content.description:
Really fun right trending finger crack! Climb up the blank face (or the easy steps to your left), pass the horizontal seam/ledge, and then the fun begins. Surprisingly good crack and face holds. Finish in the short, steep, right facing corner.

Descent:

Walk off right.
content.protection: Small cams to 0.1 - 1" and nuts. Bolts (no chains) at top of route.
content.location: Left most crack on a light colored face.

content.description: Mellower climbing through bolts and gear. At the final head wall, head right on a rail to where a crack splits the final panel. Place some gear, and pull the final mantel to the top.
content.protection: Mixed bolts and gear, bolt anchor.
content.location: Part of the Left Croc Rock climbs. Climbs the left side panel near the edge of the big roof.

content.description:
An old Hutchinson TR project that was called 5.9+ in the Dockins guide.

A proper inversion roof crack that goes from hands to offwidth
content.protection: Doubles, hands to 6s should do it.  Bolts up top.
content.location: A couple formations above the Croc Rock proper.   Go up on the left side of the formations.  Faces uphill.

content.description:
Fun, but short, right leaning hand crack in a small dihedral.

Descent:

Walk off right. Could use some chains to avoid cleaning anchor on exposed, sloping edge...
content.protection:
Light rack, emphasis on hands. Singles from 0.3-3 should be fine, but a BD#4 is nice too. Bolts (no chains) at top of crack.

Be careful on this ledge. It slopes pretty steep downhill. The less bold among us can use the bolts 15' back from the edge above Black Corner/Kennedy's to rappel down to these bolts to safely set/clean the anchor.
content.location: Right in the middle of the clean wall. Scramble up onto a nice big belay ledge. Obvious hand crack with a slight bulge about halfway up.

content.description: Left leaning, overhanging super thin finger crack.
content.protection: Small/micro nuts and cams. Bolts for TR can be reached by climbing the 5.6 corner just to the left to gain the top.
content.location: East facing alcove left and downhill of Kennedy's.

content.description: Starts in a shallow hanging corner. Thin climbing leads to an even thinner roof encounter at a small seam. A stout boulder problem leads to easy climbing to the top. Traverse over to the common anchor.
content.protection: Precise, but good, gear placements... I liked a Ballnut at the roof to save space for the finger lock.
content.location: Starts to the right of Alligator Slap. Right most route on Left Croc Rock. Approach by heading down stream of the actual “Croc”.

content.description: Climb the hand crack to the base of the roof. Take a breath, clip the bolt in the roof, and climb out the rail to the upper head wall. Keep trying hard until the anchors.
content.location: Part of the Left Croc Rock area. This route climbs out the big roof.

content.description:
Climb up past a horizontal seam through the corner a ways, then out onto the thin face. Really cool finishing sequence.

Descent:

Walk off right.
content.protection: This would be a scary, BOLD lead on gear. Best top-roped. Bolts (no chains) directly above route (shares with Kennedy's crack) and 15' back on ledge. Bring long webbing/cord or a rope and use the farther back bolts to approach the route bolts if not comfortable setting up a TR on the sloping edge.
content.location: 10 feet down and  left of Crocodile Crack. Start in a dark open book feature.

content.description: Perfect flared hands. Left, right, left, right, repeat.
content.location: The obvious hand crack on the left end of Croc Rock.
